page.title: 02The friendly folk of FINTRY
page.content:
Unlike some parts of the country where newcomers wait years to be accepted, Scots hospitality is legendary. This is nowhere more true than in Fintry.
The incomer is welcomed and if from the more reticent south, can become slightly overwhelmed by it all.
What do we find to do in such a small village in the evenings ? Like many such communities, the problem is more one of trying to spend time at home.
You can live quietly, but most join in something. Everybody knows everybody, and help when needed is always there.
When it comes to choosing somewhere to live, Fintry - like many similar sized communities - demonstrates that { "small IS beautiful".
